content.description: Crush start in thin finger crack working to nice horizontal hold.  Rock improves to straight in finger crack and hand jams to the top.  Solid pro.
content.protection: Standard rack, nuts useful and small cams

content.description: Start at small gully right of Sand Creek and move right up to blocky crux.  Continue up crack to right to shared anchor with Ghost Dance or climb out and belay from top.

Start in corner below high pinned block.  Pass two bolts to begin sustained and varied climbing requiring short chimney section with excellent pro.  Crux at transition from sweat lodge to splitter finger crack.  Challenging. You have to step up and try this route.
content.protection: Standard rack.  Crack eats all finger sizes. #3 camalot in chimney, total of 3 bolts.  Rap from quick links.
content.location: Upstream of Acoma, Wounded Knee, Mystic Massacre.

content.description: Next dihedral up stream from Ghost Dance.  Crux at wide crack and bulge,  good pro with adequate rest between athletic  movements,  use anchor on Ghost Dance or belay from above.
content.protection: Standard rack adequate, might like a #4 camalot for turning the roof.
content.location: Obvious right facing crack upstream of Ghost Dance

content.description: Crux at awkward start and again at buldge with thin finger crack. Shares start with Dog Soldiers crack to left.
content.protection: Excellent.  Small to medium cams to 2 bolt ring anchor
content.location: Just right of obvious hand crack on same wall. Share anchor. 10 meters right of stunning overhanging hand crack.

content.description: Fingers to off width crack climb to left of Rambunctious arête. Starts in clean finger crack widening to off width at top,  small pro to be had in upper crack or bring large pieces.  Anchor can be reached to left or climb off.  Belay from rim rock with gear anchor possible. Saw a healthy Big Horn Ram today on the way into the crag.
content.protection: Finger to off width. Run out to anchor on awkward off width at top.

content.description: Continuous thoughtful climbing around blunt arête on excellent rock just downstream of Cuerno Verde. Crux at 5th bolt.
content.protection: 6 bolts to ring anchors at large ledge.
content.location: Start left of Cuerno in shallow scoop right of arête. 3 bolts to nice hands free rest then to tricky feet intensive crux off crimp. Finish on large ledge.

content.description: Thin left facing finger crack in shallow corner to ledge below hand to fist crack.Po'pay gave a knotted rope to each runner as a calendar to signal the start of the pueblo revolt.
content.protection: Standard rack. RP's and small cams for first third to hand, fist size above.  2 bolt anchor.
content.location: 30M Upstream from other grouped climbing. Nice ground up lead by Bob D.

content.description:
Climb off width crack to ledge.  Follow 2 bolts to crux at base of finger crack. Combination of jamming and pockets leads to 2 bolt anchor. Rap off. 

Mystic Massacre
content.protection: Can be done with full rack of camalots.  I used double red and green.

content.description: Fun, overhanging arete on nice rock with great holds.  Crux at traverse to arete and sustained to anchor. Nice short pump and good warmup.
content.protection: 5 bolts to 2 bolt anchor, lower from rings.
content.location: Start just left of large boulders, climb easy terrain to first bolt and up to large ledge.  Clip second bolt and climb up to left then traverse back right to arete.

content.description: Start below the beautiful overhanging hand crack in a left-leaning finger crack. Traverse up and right through easy climbing until you are at the triangle pod. Put gear in here because the next moves are tough. Getting established in the hand crack is the crux. Powerful and fun moves through the overhanging hand crack up to the second pod. The route is basically over once you're through the overhanging section. Follow the hand crack up to a ledge. Follow the dihedral which is cruiser 5.8 climbing. Finish with a gear anchor at the top of the dihedral or head right to the two bolt anchor for Cuerno Verde.
content.protection: The lower pod takes either a .75 or .5 depending on where you place it. The hand crack loves yellow #2s. The dihedral takes small gear to #1. The anchor could use some wide gear if you're crazy enough to haul it up, otherwise you can fit a #2, #3, #1 or a .75 deep in the top of the crack.
content.location: The obvious and beautiful overhanging hand crack to the left of Cuerno Verde. Right of the left facing corner and the unknown sport route.

content.description: Overhanging open book just right of Tecumsah.  Scramble up low angle corner to large, rocky ledge.  Start at undercling hand crack to small stance.  Sustained finger jam, face pockets and excellent stemming to anchors. Crux at top.
content.location: Right of dog soldier finger crack.

content.description:
Start just to right of large boulders at base of wall. Climb up to good gear in finger crack then reach left to thin crack. Protect with small wires. Pilar in shallow corner is hollow but sound on first ascent. Crux at top. Best to set anchor and belay from top.

Gasbuggy Popular Mechanics Gacbuggy (Fracking by A-Bomb)
content.protection: Small wires up to red Camelot.

content.description:
Crux at start with good gear in thin crack and sound red camalot further up to right. Move left at ledge to hand crack. Nice hand jams mixed with face holds to anchor. 

  May have had previous ascent, please let us know.
content.protection: Small cams to start to standard rack above.  Double red useful but not necessary. Share ring anchors on face with Sand Creek.
content.location: Obvious clean hand crack 10 meters upstream from original Panorama climbs.

content.description:
Segmented finger crack to crux traverse into corner on large ledge. right facing corner up to Offwidth finish.  Gear anchor for belay at top. 

Cuerno Verde
content.protection: standard rack to #4 Camalot.  Walk off.

content.description: Start through broken, blocky face to stance at base of chimney. Offwidth with crux at short, shallow chimney midway. Tricky pro, but can protect in deep finger sized horizontal to right and at top of offwidth. Build anchor at top on right. Walk off.
content.protection: Standard rack of camalots, Bob brought a #4 but not necessary.
content.location: Just right of Knotted Rope under obvious chimney.

content.description:
Start in shallow alcove to narrowing high corner,  mono with opposed arm bar as an option lend to strenuous exit to good holds.  These are hard to leave as you traverse out on the technical crux past three bolts.  A fall here could chop your ankle. The upper wall has nice rock and relents a bit to the anchors shared with Wounded Knee. 

  Of the few dozen Acoma men of fighting age still alive after the battle, Oñate ordered the right foot chopped off of each one. Oñate was later tried and convicted of cruelty to Indians and colonists, and was banished from New Mexico. However, he was cleared of all charges on appeal and lived out the rest of his life in Spain 

Revenged in sybolism only..
content.location: Just right of original Panorama cracks.

content.description: East facing basalt wall with several old trad and sport routes.  Potential for many trad pitches (some with possible previous ascents, now with anchors)
